sect1.title: BIND Utilities-&bind-version;

sect2.title: Installation of BIND Utilities
sect2.para: Install BIND Utilities by running the following commands:

screen.userinput: ./configure --prefix=/usr && make -C lib/isc && make -C lib/dns && make -C lib/ns && make -C lib/isccfg && make -C lib/bind9 && make -C lib/irs && make -C bin/dig && make -C doc

sect2.para: This portion of the package does not come with a test suite.

screen.userinput: make -C lib/isc install && make -C lib/dns install && make -C lib/ns install && make -C lib/isccfg install && make -C lib/bind9 install && make -C lib/irs install && make -C bin/dig install && cp -v doc/man/{dig.1,host.1,nslookup.1} /usr/share/man/man1

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: --disable-doh: Use this option if you have not installed and you don't need DNS over HTTPS support.
make -C lib/...: These commands build the libraries that are needed for the client programs.
make -C bin/dig: This command builds the client programs.
make -C doc: This command builds the manual pages if the optional Python module is installed.
Use cp -v doc/man/{dig.1,host.1,nslookup.1} /usr/share/man/man1 to install the manual pages if they have been built.
